title: Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party

pages.name: Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party
pages.description:
Rule 163 of the Provincial Court Family Rules requires you to file a Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party in Form 43 when you stop representing a party and serve a copy on each other party as soon as possible. If the party has a new lawyer the party, or the new lawyer must file a Notice of Lawyer for Party in Form 43 and serve a copy on each other party as soon as possible.

You do not need to file a Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party if the limited purpose for which the lawyer was representing the party has ended.

Use this pathway to complete your Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party.

elements.name: ApplicantType
elements.title: Please select the statement below that applies to you.
elements.description: If you are helping someone complete this pathway, answer as if you were them.

elements.name: ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your name?
elements.description: This is the name of the lawyer for the party. If you are filing out this form for a lawyer for the party, fill in their name.
elements.descFirstName: First Name is also known as Given Name
elements.descMiddleName: If you have more than one Middle Name, write them all in this box with spaces separating your Middle Names
elements.descLastName: Last Name is also known as Family Name or Surname

elements.name: ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your name?
elements.description: This is the name of the party.
elements.descFirstName: First Name is also known as Given Name
elements.descMiddleName: If you have more than one Middle Name, write them all in this box with spaces separating your Middle Names
elements.descLastName: Last Name is also known as Family Name or Surname

elements.name: OtherPartyInfoNlpr
elements.title: What is the name of the party you are no longer representing?

elements.name: LawyerName
elements.title: What is the name of the lawyer who is no longer representing you?

elements.name: EffectiveDate
elements.title: On what date does the change of representation start?
elements.description: Select the date when the lawyer is no longer representing the party. It may be a past, present or future date. This date will be noted on your court file. You are still responsible for making sure you have copies of any court documents that are filed before you have filed your Notice of Removal of Lawyer for Party and served a copy on each other party.
